questions.solution:
We have,

A+B=π6

⇒B=π6-A

Now,

tan⁡A+tan⁡B=tan⁡A+tan⁡π6-A

=tan⁡A+13-tan⁡A1+tan⁡A3

=x+1-3x3+x [where tan A = =x]

=3x+x2+1-3x3+x

=x2+1x+3=fx(say)

∴fx=x2+1x+3

⇒f''x=2xx+3-(x2+1)x+32

=x2+23x-1(x+3)2

For minimum, f’(x)=0

⇒x2+23x-1=0

⇒x=-23±12+42

=-23±42=3±2

Now, f''''(x) )at x=2-3 is positive

So, f(x) is minimum at x=2-3

∴tan⁡A=2-3

⇒A=π12

∴B=π6-π12=π12

∴ Minimum value of tan A + tan B

=2tan⁡A=2(2-3)

=4-23

questions.nameText:
Let P={θ:sin⁡θ-cos⁡θ=2cos⁡θ} and

	 Q={θ:sin⁡θ+cos⁡θ=2sin⁡θ} be two sets. Then
questions.solution:
We have,

P={θ:sin⁡θ-cos⁡θ=2cos⁡θ} and

Q={θ:sin⁡θ+cos⁡θ=2sin⁡θ}

Now,

sin⁡θ-cos⁡θ=2 cos⁡θ

⇒(sin⁡θ-cos⁡θ)2=2cos2⁡θ

⇒sin2⁡θ+cos2⁡θ-2sin⁡θcos⁡θ=2cos2⁡θ

⇒sin2⁡θ=cos2⁡θ+2sin⁡θcos⁡θ

⇒2sin2⁡θ=sin2⁡θ+cos2⁡θ+2 sin⁡θcos⁡θ

⇒2sin2⁡θ=(sin⁡θ+cos⁡θ)2

⇒2sin⁡θ=sin⁡θ+cos⁡θ

∴P=Q [taking positive square root]

questions.nameText: The value of tan⁡θ+2tan⁡2θ+4tan⁡4θ+8cot⁡8 θ  is

tanθ = cot θ - 2 cot 2θ ... (2)

Now tan θ + 2tan 2θ + 4tan 4θ + 8cot 8θ

= (cot θ - 2 cot 2θ) + 2 tan 2θ + 4 tan 4θ + 8 cot 8θ using equation (2)

= cot θ - 2(cot 2θ - tan 2θ) + 4 tan 4θ + 8 cot 8θ

= cot θ.

questions.name: In a triangle ABC, if the tangent of half the difference of two angles is equal to one third of the tangent of half the sum of the angles, then the ratio of the sides opposite to the angles is
questions.nameText: In a triangle ABC, if the tangent of half the difference of two angles is equal to one third of the tangent of half the sum of the angles, then the ratio of the sides opposite to the angles is
questions.solution:
Let A, B and C be the angles of a triangle.

Let a, b and c be the opposite sides of these angles respectively.

According to the question,

tan⁡12A-B=13tan⁡12A+B

According to Napiers Anology, we can write the above equation as

a-ba+bcot⁡C2=13tan⁡90-C2

a-ba+bcot⁡C2=13cot⁡C2

Cancelling cot⁡C2 from the equation, we get

a-ba+b=13

3a-3b=a+b

2a=4b

a=2b

a : b=2 :1

Hence, option (A) is the correct answer

questions.nameText: If ‘+’ mans ‘-’, ‘-’ means ‘×’, ‘+’ means ‘+’ and ‘×’ means ‘+’, then 15 – 3 + 10 × 5 ÷ 5 = ?
questions.solution:
The given expression is 15 – 3 + 10 × 5 ÷ 5

Using the symbols correctly as given in the above question, the above expression becomes

15 × 3 – 10 ÷ 5 + 5

Using BODMAS RULE, we get

Therefore, the value of the given expression = 48

questions.name: Anjuman was counting down from 32 and Neha was counting upwards the numbers starting from 1 and she was calling out the odd numbers. What common numbers will they call out at the same time if they were calling out at the same speed?
questions.nameText: Anjuman was counting down from 32 and Neha was counting upwards the numbers starting from 1 and she was calling out the odd numbers. What common numbers will they call out at the same time if they were calling out at the same speed?

options.name: they will not call out the same number
options.nameText: they will not call out the same number

questions.solution:
Let the nth count of both Anjuman and Neha be the same.

Then, according to the question

32+n-1-1=1+n-12

or, 32-n+1=1+2n-2

or, 33-n=2n-1

or, 3n=34

or, n=343

So, n is a fraction.

Therefore, they will not call out the same number.

In a pressure cooker, the water is brought to boil. The cooker is then removed from the stove. Now on removing lid of the pressure cooker, the water starts boiling again.



Reason:

The impurities in water bring down its boiling point.

options.name: if both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A;
options.nameText: if both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A;

options.name: if both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A;
options.nameText: if both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A;

options.name: if A is true but R is false;
options.nameText: if A is true but R is false;

options.name: if both A and R are false;
options.nameText: if both A and R are false;

questions.solution:
The pressure cooker works on the principle that boiling point of a liquid increases with an increase of vapour pressure above liquid. When water alongwith food is heated in a cooker, then the water vapour raises the superincumbent pressure. So, the temperature of boiling water becomes higher than 100° C.

When the pressure cooker is removed from the stove and its lid is removed, then pressure decreases, due to which the boiling point also decreases and water starts boiling again.

Therefore, Assertion(A) is true but Reason(R) is false.

questions.name: If 20th February, 1996, which is your date of birth, is a Tuesday. On what day of the week will your birthday fall in the year 1998?
questions.nameText: If 20th February, 1996, which is your date of birth, is a Tuesday. On what day of the week will your birthday fall in the year 1998?
questions.solution:
According to the question

20th February, 1996 = Tuesday.

Number of odd days between 20th February, 1996 and 20th February, 1998 = 3 days [∵ 1996 – 1997 = 2 odd days and 1997 – 1998 = 1 odd day]

As we know that leap year to ordinary year = 2 odd days.

Ordinary year to ordinary year = 1 odd day. [∵ 1996 is a leap year]

Therefore, birthday fall on 20th February, 1998 = Tuesday + 3 days = Friday.

questions.name: How many degrees does the minute hand covers in, the same time, in which the hour hand covers 20°?
questions.nameText: How many degrees does the minute hand covers in, the same time, in which the hour hand covers 20°?
questions.solution:
As we know that the hour hand moves through 1°2 in each minute i..e. 1°2=1 minutes..

So, 20° = 11°2×20°=40 minutes

So, the minute hand covers in 40 minutes

= 6° × 40 = 240°. [∵ We know that the minute hand moves through 6° in each minute]

Another way:

The hour hand covers 20° in =11°2×20°=40 minutes.

Therefore, the minute hand covers in 40 minutes

=4060×360°-240° [∵ 60 minutes = 1 hour 40 minutes ∵ ]

questions.name: If P × Q means ‘P’ is the sister of ‘Q’, R ÷ S means ‘R’ is the mother of ‘S’, B + D means ‘B’ is the wife of ‘D’, Q – R means ‘Q’ is the husband of ‘R’ and D = S means ‘D’ is the brother of ‘S’, which of the following would mean ‘R’ is the mother-in-law of ‘B’?
questions.nameText: If P × Q means ‘P’ is the sister of ‘Q’, R ÷ S means ‘R’ is the mother of ‘S’, B + D means ‘B’ is the wife of ‘D’, Q – R means ‘Q’ is the husband of ‘R’ and D = S means ‘D’ is the brother of ‘S’, which of the following would mean ‘R’ is the mother-in-law of ‘B’?
questions.solution:
‘R’ ⇒ mother of ‘S’

‘D’ ⇒ brother of ‘S’

So, ‘D’ is the son of ‘R’

R ÷ D ⇒ ‘R’ is the mother of ‘D’

D – B ⇒ ‘D’ is the husband of ‘B’

So, ‘R’ is the mother-in-law of ‘B’

Therefore, option (d) i.e. R ÷ D – B means ‘R’ is the mother-in-law of ‘B’.

questions.name:
82. Statements:

Some tables are chairs.

All chairs are benches.

All benches are desks.

Conclusions:

I. Some desks are tables.

II. Some benches are tables.

III. Some desks are chairs.
questions.nameText:
82.	Statements:

Some tables are chairs.

All chairs are benches.

All benches are desks.



Conclusions:

I. Some desks are tables.

II. Some benches are tables.

III. Some desks are chairs.
questions.solution:
Conclusion III:

''All chairs are benches'' + ''All benches are desks'' i.e. A + A ⇒ A i.e. ''All chairs are desks'' →Conversion ''Some desks are chairs''.

Therefore, conclusion III follows.

Conclusion I:

''Some tables are chairs'' + ''All chairs are desks'' i.e. I + A ⇒ I i.e. ''Some tables are desks’

→Conversion ''Some desks are tables'' i.e. I-type

Therefore, conclusion I follows.

Conclusion II:

''Some tables are chairs'' + ''All chairs are benches'' i.e. I + A ⇒ I i.e. ''Some tables are benches'' →Conversion ''Some benches are tables'' i.e. I-type

Therefore, conclusion II follows.

questions.name:
83. Statements:

All rats are cats.

No cow is cat.

All dogs are cows.

Conclusion:

I. No dog is rat.

II. No dog is cat.

III. No cow is rat.
questions.nameText:
83.	Statements:

All rats are cats.

No cow is cat.

All dogs are cows.



Conclusion:

I. No dog is rat.

II. No dog is cat.

III. No cow is rat.
questions.solution:
Conclusion III:

‘All rats are cats'' + ''No cow is cat'' i.e. E →Conversion ‘No cat is cow'' i.e. E ⇒ A + E ⇒ E i.e. ''No rat is cow'' →Conversion ''No cow is rat'' i.e. E

Therefore, conclusion III follows.

Conclusion II:

''All dogs are cows'' + ''No cow is cat'' i.e. A + E ⇒ E i.e. ''No dog is cat''.

Therefore, conclusion II follows.

Conclusion I:

‘All rats are cats'' + ‘No dog is cat'' i.e. E →Conversion ''No cat is dog'' i.e. E ⇒ A + E ⇒ E i.e. ''No rat is dog'' →Conversion ''No dog is rat'' i.e. E-type

Therefore, conclusion I follows.

questions.name: What are the last two digits of 72008?
questions.nameText: What are the last two digits of 72008?
questions.solution:
The last two digits of number the expansion of (7)4 = 01(2401) and if the power of 7 is any multiple of 4 the last two digits will not change,

i.e., (7)8 = 2401 ⇒ 01

(7)8 = 5764801 ⇒ 01

Since, power of 7, i.e. 2008 is a multiple of 4, the last two digits of (7)2008 will be 01.

questions.solution:
a+b+c20=a+b+c20

=C020a+b20.C0+C120a+b19.C1+…+C2020a+b0.C20

Number of terms = 21 + 20 + 19 +... + 1 = 231

Hence, option (a) is the correct answer.

questions.name: The price of a Maruti car rises by 30% while the sales of the car comes down by 20%. What is the percentage change in the total revenue?
questions.nameText: The price of a Maruti car rises by 30% while the sales of the car comes down by 20%. What is the percentage change in the total revenue?
questions.solution:
Let the original price and sale be 10 unit each.

Then, original revenue collection = 10 × 10 = 100

New price = 10 × 1.3 = 13, New sale = 10 × 0.8 = 8

New revenue collection = 104

Hence, revenue is increased by 4%.

questions.nameText: If a and b are the roots of the quadratic equation x2-10x+15=0, then find the quadratic equation whose roots are α+αβ  and β+βα.
questions.solution:
The coefficient of x in the new equation is

-α+αβ+β+βα.

=-α+β+α+β2-2αβαβ

=-10+100-3015=-150+7015

=-22015=-443

and the constant term of the equation

=α+αβ×β×βα

=αβ+α+β+1=15+10+1=26

∴ The required equation is

x2-443x+26=0 i..e.

3x2-44x+78=0

questions.name: The digits of a three-digit number A are written in the reverse order to form another three-digit number B. If B > A and B − A is perfectly divisible by 7, then which of the following is necessarily true?
questions.nameText: The digits of a three-digit number A are written in the reverse order to form another three-digit number B. If B > A and B − A is perfectly divisible by 7, then which of the following is necessarily true?
questions.solution:
Let A = 100x + 10y + z B = 100z + 10y + x

∴ B − A = 99 (z − x)

For B − A to be divided by 7, (z − x) has to be divisible by 7. Only possibility is z = 9, x = 2 and y can be any number.

So, A can be 299 and B can be 992, when y = 9.

Here, B − A = 693, which is divisible by 7.

Hence, option (b) is correct.

questions.name: A college has raised 75% of the amount it needs for a new building by receiving an average donation of Rs. 600 from the people already solicited. The people already solicited represent 60% of the people, the college will ask for donations. If the college is to raise exactly the amount needed for the new building, what should be the average donation from the remaining people to be solicited?
questions.nameText: A college has raised 75% of the amount it needs for a new building by receiving an average donation of Rs. 600 from the people already solicited. The people already solicited represent 60% of the people, the college will ask for donations. If the college is to raise exactly the amount needed for the new building, what should be the average donation from the remaining people to be solicited?
questions.solution:
Let x be the number of people who were asked for donation.

People already solicited = 0.6𝑥

Remaining people = 0.4𝑥

Amount collected from the people solicited

= 600 × 0.6𝑥 = 360𝑥, which is 75%of the amount to be collected.

Remaining amount 25% = 120𝑥.

∴ Average donation from remaining people

=120x0.4x=300

questions.name: In Nuts and Bolts factory, one machine produces only nuts at the rate of 100 nuts per minute and needs to be cleaned for 5 min after production of every 1000 nuts. Another machine produces only bolts at the rate of 75 bolts per minute and needs to be cleaned for 10 min after production of every 1500 bolts. If both the machines start production at the same time, what is the minimum duration required for producing 9000 pairs of nuts and bolts?
questions.nameText: In Nuts and Bolts factory, one machine produces only nuts at the rate of 100 nuts per minute and needs to be cleaned for 5 min after production of every 1000 nuts. Another machine produces only bolts at the rate of 75 bolts per minute and needs to be cleaned for 10 min after production of every 1500 bolts. If both the machines start production at the same time, what is the minimum duration required for producing 9000 pairs of nuts and bolts?
questions.solution:
Actual time needed by the nuts machine to manufacture 1000 nuts is 10 min.

Cleaning time after every 10 min (i.e., 1000 nuts) is 5 min. Time taken by the nuts machine to manufacture 9000 nuts = (10) (9) + (5) (8) = 130 min.

Similarly, time needed to manufacture 9000 bolts is (6) (20) + (5) (10) = 170 min.

∴ The minimum time (ignoring all other delays) to manufacture 9000 pairs of nuts and bolts is 170 min.

(which is the maximum of the two times as calculated above).

questions.name: p is a prime and m is a positive integer. How many solutions exist for the equation p6-p=m2+m+6p-1?
questions.nameText: p is a prime and m is a positive integer. How many solutions exist for the equation p6-p=m2+m+6p-1?
questions.solution:
Since, p6-pp-1=p5+p4+p3+p2+p;

the equation can also be written as

p5+p4+p3+p2+p=mm+1+6. The RHS is even as m or m+1 is even, the first term is even and the second term is even. Since, the only even primes is 2, we have p = 2=. .Substituting, we get m2+m-56=0

∴m+8m-7=0

∴m=-8 or 7

But m is a positive integer ⇒m=7

Thus, p=2 and m=7 is the only solution.

questions.name:
There are three cities:

A, B and C. Each of these cities is connected with the other two cities by at least one direct road. If a traveller wants to go from one city (origin) to another city (destination), she can do so either by traversing a road connecting the two cities directly, or by traversing two roads, the first connecting the origin to the third city and the second connecting the third city to the destination. In all, there are 33 routes from A to B (including those via C). Similarly, there are 23 routes from B to C (including those via. A). How many roads are there from A to C directly?
questions.nameText:
There are three cities:

A, B and C. Each of these cities is connected with the other two cities by at least one direct road. If a traveller wants to go from one city (origin) to another city (destination), she can do so either by traversing a road connecting the two cities directly, or by traversing two roads, the first connecting the origin to the third city and the second connecting the third city to the destination. In all, there are 33 routes from A to B (including those via C). Similarly, there are 23 routes from B to C (including those via. A). How many roads are there from A to C directly?
questions.solution:
Let the number of direct roads from A to B, B to C and C to A be x, y and z, respectively. Then,

x+yz=33,y+xz=23⇒z=6.
